definition[1]: to free someone from a debt or punishment
definition[2]: the particular piece of work that someone has been officially asked to deal with
example[1]: the remit of a senior member of staff
definition[3]: to send a payment to a person or place
example[3]: a ban preventing companies from remitting profits, dividends or capital abroad
example[4]: Our overseas branches remit a small proportion of their profits to the parent company.
definition[4]: to send a legal case from a high court to a court that deals with less important cases
example[5]: The appeal was remitted to the Employment Tribunal for a fresh hearing.
example[6]: The court has the power to remit the debt.
definition[5]: the particular area of activity or piece of work that a person or group has the responsibility for dealing with
example[7]: This problem is outside our remit.
example[8]: Our remit was to make the newsletter brighter and livelier.
